subject: Design
subcategory: Design Disasters and What They Teach Us
title: The Pepsi Logo Redesign: A $1 Million Disaster
description: A quick win: understand The Pepsi Logo Redesign: A $1 Million Disaster.

hook.text: Pepsi paid $1 million for a logo redesign backed by a 27-page document referencing the golden ratio and gravity.

buildup.text: The Arnell Group produced a 27-page strategy document referencing Da Vinci, Pythagoras, and gravitational pull.

discovery.text: The actual logo change? The white stripe in the Pepsi circle got slightly wider. That's it.

twist.text: When the document leaked, the design world laughed. Pseudo-intellectual justification masked a minimal change.

climax.text: The Pepsi fiasco shows that design rationale must be honest, not inflated with pseudoscience.

punchline.text: $1 million to make a stripe wider â€” with a 27-page document explaining why.

quiz.question: What made the Pepsi logo redesign infamous?
options: A $1M fee with a pseudo-scientific 27-page rationale for a minimal change
